5:30 - The Suction Cups (metamora ska)

7:00 - The Adm Wil Skil (oxford electronemo)

660 W. Leonard Rd.

www.thestandingbirdcage.com for more info, directions, etc...

i have tracks from my new demo available for listening on www.purevolume.com/willyskillets if anybody is interested.

i just finished recording my new record that will turn into a split with braed mape brown soon and will have a cd release for that after it's mixed and i talk to braed and nathaniel presses it. 

my straightxedge new year's party is cancelled because we temporarily don't have home insurance.

mellowship cannot play on dec 4. i have to call ian and see if abra cadaver can. or i'll call braed.  braed will save the day.  braed always saves the day.

my keyboard is coming soon.  i will be the master of electronemo. i'll tour with the postal service.

if you love something, let it go. if it comes back, it's yours. if it doesn't, it never was.
---
i'm taking a cue from my little brother and saying goodbye to livejournal, at least temporarily.

maybe you'll be here when i get back.

maybe i will.

maybe i should make a whole bunch of phrases beginning with maybe.

or maybe not.

they only want you when you're seventeen
when you're twenty one
you're no fun
they take a polaroid and let you go
so they let you know
so come on

i bought cds from:
prodigy
stereolab
smashing pumpkins

Why don't people talk? It's so easy. 
Check this out:

Person A has a problem with Person B. So what should Person A do?

A) Complain about stupid Person B to Person C. Person C will back them up. Person B is <u>always</u> in the wrong!
B) Who's driving the bus?
C) Tell Person B about the problem, and together they sort the problem out. Like in Peer Mediation, which everyone makes fun of in high school. Who needs it in high school? In high school, we know how to communicate.
D) Light Person B's pants on fire.
E) *whisper whisper whisper*






The correct answer is:

Fuck you.

i went to holland this weekend. it was hollandtastic. ashton's coming over in a little while. i bought airplane yesterday, so we may watch that. that's a great movie. i started writing a new song. it's got a weird (i want to say) yiddish rhythm, like the band from 'dummy'. i don't think that made any sense.

i'm going to northville this weekend. for skruff. i'll see scott. and mellowship, they're fun. i don't think dylan is around for some reason, but i'll check.

the weekend after is homecoming. i don't think i'll go. perhaps i will. who knows? tori is going with kyle. kyle's boyfriend doesn't go to dances. kyle is a boy's name.

i start giving anna drum lessons this week. her name is really amanda, but alex and i are certain that she introduced herself as anna, so we're going with that.

i'm going to make a cutter shirt. something like "cutting is <u>so</u> cool" or "look at me! i'm a cutter!". i need to converse with alex on it, though. i feel nostalgic for the old days of making fun of people. i better curb that soon.

i'm going to make a bright eyes shirt now.
---
and all i ask you is for another chance
another way around you, to live by circumstance, once again

who am i, to need you now?
to ask you why? to tell you no?
to deserve your love and sympathy?
you were never meant to belong to me

lisa was in my dream last night. terrifying. i think i hit her. i hope so. i've been cold all day. 

i keep getting shivery right before lunch, even when i'm warm. i just shake for no good reason. except the cold today.

i don't understand people at all. and they say you have the most control when you realize what little control you have. you can only control yourself.

but realizing it doesn't make other people any easier to live with. so the world's damned. at least it's not my fault? that's not a comfort.

if only, if only.

---
We have one chance 
One  chance... 
To get everything right 
My friends, my habits, my  Family 
They mean so much to me 
I just don't think that it's right 
I've  seen so many ships sailing 
Just heading back out again 
And go off sinkin'

every thought that i repent, 
there's another chip you haven't spent, 
and you're cashing them all in. 
where do we begin? 
to get clean again? 
can we get clean again?

i walk home alone with you
and the mood you're born into
sometimes you let me in
and i take it on the chin.
can we get clean again?
i wanna know
can we get clean again?

the god of wine comes crashing through the headlights of a car
that took you farther than you thought you'd ever want to go
we can't get back again
we can't get back again

she takes a drink and then she waits
the alcohol it permeates
and soon the cells give way
and cancels out the day
i can't keep it all together
i know...
i can't keep it all together

and the siren's song that is your madness
holds a truth i can't erase
all alone on your face

every glamorous sunrise
throws the planets out of line
a star sign out of whack
a fraudulent zodiac
and the god of wine is crouched down in my room
you let me down, i said it
now i'm going down
and you're not even around
i said no...
i can't keep it all together
i can't keep it all together

and there's a memory of a window,
looking through i see you
searching for something i could never give you
and there's some who understands you more than i do
a sadness i can't erase
all alone on your face
---
what do you do when the star you're aiming for burns out?
what if it doesn't reignite?
do you settle for a dimmer star?
and how can i see without the sun?
it can't be night forever.
someone better turn on a light.
someone better be you.

i think thoughts at you all the time
they are lovely thoughts
things that would make you smile
or would have
i cannot say them now though
so i press them into your mind via telepathy
and maybe you don't hear them
but maybe they slip into your memory
and you remember me saying them, back when i could
and you smile
the loveliest smile

So why do you leave these questions unanswered?
The circus awaits and you're already gone
My cheshire cat doorstop with fear in your smile
What makes it so easy for you to be walking by?
And what did I do that you don't seem to want me?
Why do we lie here and whisper goodbyes?
Where can I go that your pictures won't haunt me?
And what did you find that could leave you walking by?

I am in Northville. Northville is fun. I do not know if I am coming back here on Sunday. I am thinking that I will not. I am in a strange mood, I would like to be in my own bed tonight.

Talk. plays my sister's birthday party on friday.

I am wearing Dylan's clothes. I brought only one outfit of my own.

I am working on a new song, but have to change the melody. Its current melody was ripped off of Brendan Benson's "Life in the D".

Brendan Benson says: "My life in the D/was a tragic comedy/A poetic verse"

Willy Skillets says: "If light hurts my eyes/They've been opened wider/I'll donate a few pints for some truth//Surely, tomorrow/will follow tonight/And he swears up and down his sun will be bright"
now i wonder how i was made

these days
i'm so messed up
never know what time it is
jet lag's the price to pay
to play show biz

Tomorrow is Curiosa. Today is Spend Too Much Time In Front Of Screens. I wonder if anybody is coming over tonight. I thought they were. And I wonder if we are having a clue party before Curiosa tomorrow. And I wonder if Talk is playing at Mr. B's on Sunday. Which would tell me if I'm going to Northville on Sunday or Monday.

But, I'm coming back from Northville on that Friday, and I'm going to Adrian to play my sister's birthday party. And Dylan is coming back with me. And Scott might come back. And then we are playing a grad party the next day. And then I return to Northville. Action-packed.

Bryon and Liat are (separately) coming to the show on Saturday. And Nathaniel's father said the fliers Noah and I made were entirely indecent. Which is cool. I need something to do.

(cough) (cough) (cough)
Curiosa is on wednesday. Today, I have band practice. We're putting my drum set on the roof in preparation for the show we're playing at my sister's house for her birthday. Thursday by Six wants to play the show on saturday, but I think this is a bad idea, considering we already have two billion bands. So I suggested Nathaniel see if they want to play on the 28th. And Smalltown Revolver isn't verified. Maybe if Smalltown doesn't play TB6 can. I better e-mail Nathaniel.

logan's quiz

1. on a scale 1-10 how awesome are you: 2
2. what is your name: willy
3. how many kids have you kicked in the face: not enough
4. were you wearing shoes?: yes
5. if so, what kind of shoes were they?: aqua socks
6. what is your favorite food?: water
7. what is your favorite band?: death cab for cutie
8. do you bow down to logan as if he was a god?: he is a god
9. does logan think you are pretty awesome?: i hope so
10. what is your favorite quote?: "man oh man"

i keep telling myself though, "if it's meant to be, it's meant to be". that's the best i got. and there's got to be someone else. somewhere. probably europe though. and i can't afford to go to europe. man.

(sigh)

i think i'm going to see tina this saturday. i hope so. i will call her now.

you ain't got much money.
but she's sooooo in love with you honey.

time's up for today, mac. can't be late for my 3 o'clock.

in the morning?
tina, my sister, you should go to holland so i can see you. i miss you.

show did not happen sunday. or rather, the should did not happen sunday. that's okay. i'm arranging a barn show for aug. 28, the first show of the school year, occurring the first week of school. i'm starting this year write. i mean, right. that was not on purpose. stupid omens.

nate's show will be fun. i hope everyone goes. www.noobject.2ya.com . aug 14, 5-10, free, with swimming. address is on the website.

tina, i may give you the morbidly awesome gift of affection. as of yet, i do not know who it is going to. it has to be someone who will not be creeped out. and this cuts the list down to about no one. alas, alack.

only a liar would wear pizza box wings.

once upon a time, i came up with an idea of a death day greeting card. inside, it would read "wishing you the very best, in this life and the next."

my computer will not burn the ugly organ onto the new cd's i bought. alas.

i have a should sunday. alex is going with me. he is going to wear the ski goggles he stole from logan and attempt to pick up babes. i will sing emo songs about my very broken heart.

i bought new shoes. fancy pointy noah-poser shoes. and then i bought aqua socks which are twice as cool as the shoes.

i am creating the most awesome morbidly twisted gift of affection of all time.

i need to do something. anything.

i hereby ban myself from the internet. it's much too depressing.

i bought my curiosa ticket. and alex's. shane left for florida. i dunno if ashton's home yet. nathaniel's show will be in august on the sixteenth or something, but that looks like it will actually happen. i leave for northville tomorrow. \m/

synapse to synapse, the possibilities thin
i'm dressed up for free drinks and family greetings on your wedding
your wedding
your wedding date

figures 
in plastic
on a wedding cake

that i took

they're so real

and i kept a distance, the complications cloud
the postcards and blips, through fiberoptics as the girls with
the pigtails
were running from
little boys wearing
bow ties
their parents bought:

i'll catch

you this time

crashing through the parlour doors
what was your first reaction?
screaming, drunk, disorderly,
i'll tell you mine

you were the one
but i can't
spit it out when
the dates been set
the white routine
to be ingested inaccurately

synapse to synapse, the sneaky kids have attached
beer cans to the bumper, so they can drive
up and
down the 
main drag
people
will look to see
what's making the racket

it's not

the first time

when they lay down, the fish will swim upstream
and i'll contest, but they won't listen when the casualty
rate's near
one hundred percent
and there isn't
a pension
for second best

or for hardly

moving

crashing through the parlour doors
what was your first reaction?
screaming, drunk, disorderly,
i'll tell you mine

you were the one
but i can't
spit it out when
the date's been set
the white routine
to be ingested inaccurately

liat left for camp today. i'm sending her a hardcore awesome/emo care package complete with glow in the dark stars. fun. i talked to dylan today, and i'm going to go to northville for a week very soon, because i realized how much i miss that guy. his chick broke up with him two weeks ago. oh the irony. but they got back together. which is cool, i'm glad he's happy. my dad's credit card received the lollapalooza money, so i'm using it to buy cure tickets. interpol will be really cool. and i'm excited to see cursive. and the rapture. oh, and the cure. i wish i was at camp too...

why don't we stop fooling ourselves?
the game is over
over
over
no good times
no bad times
there's no times at all except the new york times

sitting on the windowsill
with the flowers

we might as well be apart
it hardly matters
we sleep separately

drop a smile
passing in the hall
but there's no laughs left
'cause we laughed them all
and we laughed them all
in a very short time

is tapping on my shoulder
hanging from my mirror
rattling the tea cups
and i wonder

how long can i delay?
we're just a habit
like saccharin

and i'm habitually feelin' kinda blue...

but each time i try on the thought of leaving you
i stop

stop and think it over

--

i am still not so good, but i suppose time heals. think positive. i'm going to the movies tomorrow. don't tell hans.

i had seven faces
though i knew which one to wear
i'm sick of spending these lonely nights
training myself not to care

the subway she is a porno
the pavements they are a mess
i know you've supported me, for a long time
somehow, i'm not impressed

new york cares

it's up to me now, turn on the bright lights
it's up to me now, turn on the bright lights
it's up to me now, turn on the bright lights
it's up to me now, turn on the bright lights

i am going to see rufus wainwright and ben folds tonight. i am excited.

i am going to camp tomorrow. that will be nice.

katey and i talked today. it was somewhat nice.

*(content changed)i am fucking scared out of my mind of the future.

i would like to see my older sister.

wake
from your sleep
the drying of your tears
today
we escape
we escape

before

breathe, keep breathing

there's
such a chill

and you can laugh
a spineless laugh
we hope

and wisdom

i am sad. and post my emotions on the very emo-trendy livejournal. disgusting.

breathe in warm exhaust
low on tar, low on cost
breathe in warm exhaust
gets you there, gets you lost
breathe in warm exhaust
low on tar, low on cost
breathe in warm exhaust
angry sea, tempest tossed

shield your eyes from no star but the sun

through doors and imaginary floors 
"why can't you miss me?" 
pistol pete removes the final breaths from her unkind and she is shaken 
what does this mean in love or in peace? 
with you lying next to me 
so faithless serene 
and she calls to him 

let the waste cross the ancient trails to you 
far out beneath the sorrow clouds 
let them taste the bitter lost mistake of you 
let them cry out through your rusted scars 

alone he roams inside the ordinary catacombs of her waiting 
with raven hands she steals and staggers towards her man 
still scorned by his demon 

because he's undone 
become the language of 
disaster and love, vengeance and dust 
and she calls to him 

let the waste cross the ancient trails to you 
far out beneath the sorrow clouds 
let them taste the bitter lost mistake of you 
let them cry out through your rusted scars 

dusty screams, through doors and imaginary scenes 
of hurt and teardrop 
as he holds her down, in the cold lonely winds 
together again, her inside him 
and she calls to him 

let the waste cross the ancient trails to you 
far out beneath the sorrow clouds 
let them taste the bitter lost mistake of you 
let them cry out through your rusted scars

On Sunday, Shane, my brother and I all went to the Phantom Planet show. The first band was Steriogram, from New Zealand. They were the most humorous band I've ever seen (in a bad way.) They were like Sum 41's music, with Good Charlotte's appearance, and a monkey rapping. The lead singer was a scarecrow, 6'3", and thinner than Noah. He moved like a monkey and sang the worst lyrics. And then every chorus would be all four of the other band members singing a melody (not harmony) while the rap guy rapped over it. They were the essence of Hot Topic, in a band. They had a song about how the lead singer's mother was fat. And their first single in the U. S. is called "Walkie Talkie Man". A couple frat boys were really rocking out to it and when I saw I laughed and one of them flipped me off. People are funny.

The second band was The Thrills, from Dublin, Ireland. They were superb. They played a kind of classy garage 70's rock with country influence (in a good way.) When they did one of their songs, "Not for All the Love in the World", they dimmed the stage lights and put on this yellow glowing disco type ball over the crowd. And towards the end they turned the stage lights completely off for ten seconds or so and left the disco ball on. It was very cool. Oh, also the guitarist and bassist switched instruments for the second half of the set. That was groovy.

And Phantom Planet was awesome too. There was a very inebriated woman in her late twenties who was dancing like those type do, in a very unfitting style for the setting, moving her pelvis a significant amount more than necessary and grabbing the security guy (who was standing on a chair to watch the crowd)'s hand and dancing with him. It was a very Mtv friendly setting, which kinda weakened it, but Phantom Planet did an awesome job. During the encore, the lead singer climbed from the second level (which was closed) onto people's hands and proceeded to walk to the bar. A very cool show.

And also, I was rejected from camp and will therefore have to get a real job. Ouch.

Last night was the death cab and ben kweller show. It was superb. Ben Kweller tends to bore me after not too long, but he put on a good show. The opener was 'aveo', i believe. They were really good, then not so good, then good again. And Death Cab ruled as always. During Ben Kweller's set, Violet and I went and got to talk to Death Cab's guitarist, which was pretty cool, he signed my cd booklet. Nice guy. Emo kids are nice folks.

I'm stuck at my dad's until six, when I have a drum lesson. Then I get to go home.

I spent a long time emailing as many venues as possible. I think we'll get some shows.

I am sad.

so everyone may know the events of last night:

At 6:30ish, Violet, Noah, Shane and I arrive at Oxford High School for the Talent Show which begins at 7. Noah has his guitar, and I have drumsticks. We are not one of the acts listed on the program.

The program begins. A stupid video made by Oxford's video media class is aired. A few people laugh. (okay, maybe more than a few). It's a mediocre attempt, at best. After the video ends, the acts begin. We have Boone doing a guitar solo and running around being metal, some ridiculously strippers, er, i mean dancers and something else.

I notice the evil ogre woman (ms. Otte) walk by. Yes, not only is she angry and gave me evil looks when I actually tried out for the talent show (with cry mutiny, not me and noah), but she stares at me in the halls, as if I'm a troublemaker. Well, maybe I am. She is temporarily not in front of the hall leading to the stage's back door. We make a run for it.

We slip in the door. No one is around, although we passed a few people in the hall. No on thought anything of us, nor cared.

The drama club is currently working on "You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown" and their set includes a giant Snoopy doghouse. Noah and I slip inside, where he placed his guitar earlier.

The act right now is two drummers who are doing a fine job of drumming, for much too long a period of time. Silly drummers.

Noah and I are crouched in the dark, watching people walk by, set things down, pick things up, but continue unseen.

The drummers finish and No Object begins to play. The area surrounding the doghouse appears to be clear. We step out nonchalantly and stand off to the side, in view of a few people on the other side of the stage, but no one thinks anything of us.

Just then, the ogre walks in the door. Takes a glance at us, mumbles an excuse me, and walks by. We breathe again. A few minutes later, she walks back, and stands inches away talking to some kid. Then exits.

The song reaches it's end, only the singer/rhythm guitarist and bassist are playing now. We storm the stage

Noah runs out and rips the cable from the lead guitarist's input jack (that sounds hot, doesn't it?) I run over to the drummer and give him a push. He gets up and walks away, looking at me with disgust. I start to play "Wait." Noah comes in. We play through the chorus and two lines of verse. The ogre looks at us. Looks at the program. Looks at us again. Looks at the program...

Then Mr. Wilson, the old and still unhip (though he may not believe so) walks out (doesn't shut the curtain) and turns Noah's amp off. Noah and I flee the scene via jumping off the stage. We run out the door to the sounds of laughter and applause. We hop into Shane's car and pull away. A video media kid makes a half-hearted attempt to stop us, but he's smiling and is glad to see us escape. We win.

-
Well kids, that's today's lesson in anarchy 101. Hope you enjoyed it. Next weeks lesson: How disguises can offset chances of getting suspended next time...

i feel like i'm suddenly back in a million springs ago, perhaps before ninth grade, yes, that sounds about right. some mixture of the weather and this trio song that is playing on my epitonic list (which is strange, considering i didn't hear of them until halfway through ninth grade...) and it's making me sad.

good morning heartache
you're like an old friend
come and see me again

i dunno how to describe how i feel. wait, yes i do. i'm a fuck-up. yep, that's it. blah. and i haven't even done anything recently. it's just that the sum total of my actions simply equal that.

on a lighter note, we have an mp3 online now. check the music section of
freewebs.com/crymutiny

i miss my dearest. and my big sister. and abby.

show, this friday, at st. paul's church in romeo. for full info, see the new cry mutiny website

www.freewebs.com/crymutiny

woo. should be a good time. i hope everyone goes.
we're finishing up a new song. entitled else, or (the new ska metal song).
it's very awesome.
i'm quite proud.

also, i need to apply for camp soon.

I think I'm going to buy Seymour Duncan "Pearly Gates" Humbucker. I was going to buy an SH-6, but I was listening to a bunch online, and this seems the wiser selection. And then Jadon and I are going to install it. Jadon. Who keeps forcing us to cancel practice. And then goes to auto shows when we are supposed to pick up couches. Falvey should be our bassist. Last night, he came over and we talked communism with my father for a while, then we watched fight club and fell asleep.

I also obtained more cd's.
The Flaming Lips, "Egg"
The Walkmen, "Everyone who pretended to like me is gone" "bows and arrows"
The Raveonettes "Chain Gang of Love"
This is Fort Apache (sampler disc)
Steve Burns (the guy from blue's clues)"Songs for Dust Mites" (surprisingly good)
Interpol "Turn on the Bright Lights"

and more

Everyone should listen to music more. And Noah commented on how we practice more than any band ever. And I laughed and said we should play right then. More music. Moooooooooooooooooore.

Today, Cry "Mutiny!" practiced. It was a very hardcore time indeed. We wrote two mini songs to be played on saturday. They're crazy. It will be fun. I need to get a hold of Abby and see if she wants to hang out tomorrow night. Except I know she just read that. So she should call me. Hehehe.

I miss my big sister.

I uploaded new images to livejournal. Woo.

I want to send M. A. some music or something, but I still need to tamper with the files on my computer.

My basement refuses to stop flooding.

I'm sad because I know everyone else isn't happy. How emo of me.

I don't think these pants are clean.

I get my car back tomorrow. Which broke the other day.

I need to call East Alley and find out when their last day is so Violet and I can terrorize them and get free and cheap stuff.

I need a nap.

hello again, livejournal people. i just finished this rad recording of 'thank-you notes' featuring 7 tracks of guitar and then voice. it's pretty crazy, but enjoyable. there's a show at the church on saturday, talk. and cry "mutiny!", are both playing as well as mike and chris of fermi jamming out, and brad and john of none other doing acoustic stuff. it's free and fun, i'll have the flier up tomorrow. east alley records in rochester is closing, so noah, shane, violet and i drove over there the other night and i bought smashing pumpkins "still becoming", oasis "what's the story (morning glory)?", alien ant farm "truant", lost prophets "the fake sound of progress", and tabula rasa's self-titled ep. i also obtained two giant mars volta posters, a rufus wainright poster and a modest mouse 45/33 (it's 45 rpm on one side and 33 on the other.) pretty nifty. on a final side type note, violet cut my hair. picture is here post script: violet is awesome. because she fixes willy's journal entries when he messes up. she is so awesome and everyone should buy her a pony, maybe a puppy too. and how about the world? buy the world!

hey world. i'm updating for the first time in forever. for the very thin purpose of plugging my show on saturday. i hope you all come. and also, i have made patches. out of corduroy pants i destroyed, spray paint, and stencils. enjoy, have a beautiful evening... also, violet cut my hair tonight. flier patch

Merry Christmakuh (sp?) to all. I hope everyone is having an enjoyable holiday season and has acquired all the wonderful commodities they hoped for. I have found myself possessing many wonderful gifts from many wonderful people, all undeserved including:

3 copies of J. D. Salinger's <u>Nine Stories</u>
Radiohead, "Amnesiac"
John Coltrane, "My Favorite Things"
Thelonius Monk and John Coltrane, "Thelonius Monk and John Coltrane"
The Jimi Hendrix Experience, "Are You Experienced"
Death Cab for Cutie, "You Can Play These Songs With Chords"
Death Cab for Cutie, "Something About Airplanes"
A plethora of vinyl records including The Police, Simon & Garfunkel and Billy Idol
Numerous pairs of socks
A beautiful mixed tape
A shirt that says "SNARLED"
A disco light
A hoodie
A lamp
A cool shirt
The movie, Suburbia, directed by Richard Linklater of Waking Life and Dazed and Confused
Many good books by such greats as Kurt Vonnegut Jr., Ayn Rand and more

and the most important of all, the most brilliant record of our time, or any time...

The Smashing Pumpkins, "Adore"

Which I already had, but it was a burned copy and I wanted the real thing. And now I have it. 

Thank you very much to the usual suspects (my parents, sister, brother, senile grandmother, etc.) and also to my very dear significant other, Violet, and to my extremely most swellest friend in the entire universe who buys me way to much stuff, all of which I enjoy way too much, Lisa Anna.

I was fortunate enough to view the movie Pi last night. A phenomenal film, I highly recommend it.

I still have a few more presents to dispense, to the likes of Mike Stephens and others I do not recall at the moment.

I wish Abby a happy post birthday and hope she enjoyed my gift.

I very well may be going to camp on the 28th, and will see Anne and Abby, a joyous occasion indeed, but it is not certain.

I send my love to all who already know I do. It is now your task to receive it.

On a quick side note: The other night I had a dream. I was talking to my younger sister and then she casually mentioned she got laid the other night, and I flipped out. So I am officially in freaked out older brother mode, and have been yelling at her for her shorts being too short and for giving looks to the postman for a day or two now. All testosterone injected males, stay back. I have a tazer.

hey all. i hope you are well. tomorrow is abby's birthday. i'm creating her gift now. it's super awesome and personalized. i hope she enjoys it. today my family went to see 'the producers' at the masonic temple in detroit. it was humorous. i recommend it. my mother bought me a shirt that says "make it gay!". i am wearing it tomorrow. i feel like i'm writing an essay for a third grade teacher. or talking to a peer mediator. i feel...when you.... cry mutiny played a show last night. it was eh. some people liked it. that was good. i capoed 'i'm so emo' at the third fret instead of the first and did not realize until mostly through the song, when i fixed it. eh. we're playing another show on tuesday, at cca, i believe. i have to call john siner. my mother and i got into a rather large fight today. it was sad. fighting is. love, if you can, and even if you can't, love anyway. life is what you make it. make the best of it. i miss.... i'm not sure what i miss. but i am sure i miss it. alas.

all we recall are re-runs of 'cheers'
and what jordan did after the sixth or seventh beer
cherished memories seen on negative film
with inverted colors in 1 1/2 by 1 squares

all the times i had with you could simply be reduced
to a four photo line for $2.50 in a photobooth
from when we went to the skating to no alternative's show
perfect for the song i wrote, now just circumstantial proof

all the times spent kissing, i wish that we had talked
fewer movies in your darkened room, more brisk autumn walks
nothing can compare to the blue-light christmas eve
you game me your heart in a wound line of magnetic tape

oh so lovingly, i wound the tape around your throat
over carefully covered bruises, i set you up to choke
and bloody tears from my eyes flowed freely down my face
and i tighted the ribbon you gave to me; it stretched until it broke

nothing good can come of me, i murder those i love
i stab, strangle, i cut them down, using fingerprint masking gloves
so flee while you can, prey, you're much to lovely to survive
our talent mind and innocence, make you for a much too perfect victim

lisa and i talked, and we're going to take our relationship a little less seriously so i can decide if i wish to pursue it romantically or not. kinda rough stuff. i feel rather badly, but it seemed like something that should be done. i'm so emotionally screwed up. i had a dream last night, and my mother and little brother (alex) were ragging on me about something after i got off this long hike with someone, i don't remember who. but then i climbed this big tower, and was planning on jumping off and killing myself. then i realized i wouldn't die if i did it. so i did it. and broke something in myself.

i just finished my recording of 'with apologies'. it's pretty messed up and technorific. it starts with a distorted drum machine, then i have two guitars playing harmonics, and there's vocal harmonies and distorted vocals. i'm uploading it to mp3.com in a minute.

last night, i did a new recording of maybe. i added organ and bongos. it's kinda cool. i'm going to upload that too.

i bought a lot of cool stuff for everyone for christmas. including you, sis. so be happy. i spent $110 at salvation army. and only had $70. so i borrowed some from mrs. wietor, and my mother paid her back. and i'm paying my mother back. i hope everyone enjoys their presents.

(sigh)

with apologies
by willy skillets

but i confess
i wore you like a blood-stained dress
and hanged you on a wire frame
which doubtless couldn't take the strain
stretching down, bent out of shape
a silk sleeve ripped in rape

but i detest
my grievous indifference
i dropped you like my cigarettes
as a sin, a vice, a coming death
a bitter silence as farewell
i toasted to your hell

Tonight, I go to play the unplugged thing at Christ the Cul...i mean Christ the King church.  It will be a good time. Lisa and I got in trouble for being home alone. And then we had lecture from my mother and I was allowed to explain some things and so it's not quite as bad.

Thanks to all, you're very kind.

My band needs to practice, soon. Because I write music much too fast.

Oh, Cry Mutiny (my band) is playing an acoustic show in two weeks and Tony and I wrote an incredibly cool piano part (I gave him chords and he made it awesome) and the song is just us two and it is so awesome i am in love with it, the song is "Violet" and it's sad and emo.

All is full of love.............................believe it..................

So I'm introducing Lisa Anna to the beauty that is Homestar Runner. I think 'Crazy Cartoon' is in order.

On Friday, we're practicing minus Tony and Jadon, so just Justin, PJ and I. This weekend I'm at my dad's, so I need to call Scott.

Stars are pretty tonight.

Oh, and Tina comes tomorrow! Today, my mother was talking to her on the phone, and I asked to talk to Dave, her boyfriend. So he came on the line and I said, "Dave, make sure you come over tomorrow, and we'll burn one down." It was funny. I have officially allowed him into the fold.

End.

Tonight, I'm going to go see "Gothica" with Lisa.  And I'm going to learn the guitar solo stuff to "Headfirst for Halos" by My Chemical Romance, who I've acquired quite a taste for since the Static Lullaby show. And I'm going to start giving drum lessons within the week (hopefully.) \m/.

lisa anna is more than skinny enough. and does not need to lose weight. and if she gained weight, would still be beautiful, unless perhaps she got so huge she pulled earth off it's rotation and we were all destroyed. until then, she's beautiful. and if she's smiling, then everything is okay. and she is talented beyond belief, and can do everything ever. and she is graceful. and she never falls, because she is a dancer. and a ballerina. and she saves me. and everyone can know it.

So lisa anna thinks i should update my journal. So i am. And I'm having a good time doing it. And she's putting a  thing on my neck. (not a hickey) (a necklace of some sort). And we're having spaghetti tonight. Abby, don't worry, the curse will not take effect. I need to find my train of thought. And to go to more shows, because i do not go to enough.

ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

awaaaaaaaaaaayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy

i like lisa anna.
she gets to stay.
lisa anna, party of one. your table is ready.

oh, last night at the musical, i added my fun bonus line even though i was told i was not allowed to beforehand. At some point, amy verbeke asks the gamblers if any will give testimony as to why they are bad people and such, and i yell "no one's touching my testimonies!" and it's awesome and people laugh and are joyous and smiles.

and lisa anna and my sister bought my cool balloons even though lisa anna gave me a flower the night before and i was very excited. and she is my girlfriend type figure and goes to all my plays almost and it is nice. and i smile for no good reason. except that she's sitting next to me.

that's all.

I'm in northville for the evening, to have dinner with my aunt betsy. Scott wasn't home, so I went to the library to play on the internet. Voila, a journal entry.
	Tomorrow, I have early morning (9ish) breakfast with Jadon, Justin, PJ, Lisa and hopefully Tony, if I talk to him. And then Teggerdine plays for a while, and is consistently awesome. And then Jadon, Justin, Lisa and I go to see Mock Orange and Switchblade Romance at Idle Kids, which I am thoroughly stoked for, as Mock Orange has not been out here in I dunno how long, but definitely not since I've been into them. So that will be an awesome show. Sunday, I go to church, chill with Violet until my dress rehearsal at one, and then home again. Then the week starts over again, only more hectic this time, because the play occurs on wed, thurs, fri and sat. And we are not ready. Oh well, doesn't bother me, as I am merely Rusty Charlie. Rock on. Have a good one, all.
